Event.name: Setting_out
Event.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Self_mover</fen> begins a journey at a <fen>Source</fen> location, in a particular <fen>Direction</fen>generally setting out with an <fen>Intended_goal</fen> in mind.
<ex><fex name="Time">At about 1:00 in the morning</fex>, <fex name="Self_mover">climbers</fex> <t>set out</t> <fex name="Intended_goal">for the summit</fex>.</ex> <ex><fex name="Self_mover">The expedition</fex> <t>set out</t> <fex name="Source">from Granada</fex> <fex name="Time">early in March</fex>, leaving only one hundred men to garrison the fort which overlooks the city.</ex> <ex><fex name="Time">After that</fex> <fex name="Self_mover">the earl</fex> <t>set out</t> <fex name="Direction">south</fex> <fex name="Cotheme">with his host</fex>, and Kari went with him, and Njal's sons too.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Self_mover
Arg.definition: <def-root>This is the entity which moves under its own power. </def-root>

Arg.name: Source
Arg.definition:
<def-root>Any expression which implies a definite starting-point of motion expresses the frame element <fen>Source</fen>. In prepositional phrases, the prepositional object expresses the starting point of motion. In particles, the starting point of motion is understood from context.
</def-root>

Arg.name: Path
Arg.definition: <def-root>A relation to a landmark that describes the trajectory in the midst of the motion. (It is thus neither a <fen>Source</fen> nor the <fen>Intended_goal</fen>.) </def-root>

Arg.name: Intended_goal
Arg.definition: <def-root>Any expression which tells where the <fen>Self_mover</fen> intends to end up as a result of the motion.</def-root>

Arg.name: Manner
Arg.definition: <def-root>Any expression which describes a property of motion which is not directly related to the trajectory of motion expresses the frame element <fen>Manner</fen>. Descriptions of steadiness, grace, means of motion, and other things count as <fen>Manner</fen> expressions. </def-root>

Arg.name: Means
Arg.definition: <def-root>An event involving the <fen>Self_mover</fen> that results in the <fen>Self_mover</fen> moving in the specified way. </def-root>

Arg.name: Speed
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Speed</fen> is the rate at which the <fen>Self_mover</fen> moves.</def-root>

Arg.name: Cotheme
Arg.definition:
<def-root>A second moving object which the <fen>Self_mover</fen> moves to follow.
</def-root>

Arg.name: Depictive
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The state of the <fen>Self_mover</fen> during the action.
</def-root>

Arg.name: Place
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Place</fen> is where the motion (which is specified by a <fen>Source</fen>, <fen>Path</fen> or <fen>Goal</fen>) is located.</def-root>

Arg.name: Path_shape
Arg.definition: <def-root>The configuration formed by the entire <fen>Path</fen> of the <fen>Self_mover</fen>, taken simultaneously. </def-root>

Arg.name: Direction
Arg.definition: <def-root>The direction in which the <fen>Self_mover</fen> goes. </def-root>

Arg.name: Time
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The time at which the motion takes place.
</def-root>

Arg.name: Purpose
Arg.definition: <def-root>The state-of-affairs that the <fen>Self_mover</fen> wishes to bring about. </def-root>

Arg.name: Vehicle
Arg.definition: <def-root>The device or bodypart that serves to move the <fen>Self_mover</fen>. </def-root>

Arg.name: Duration_of_final_state
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The length of time that the <fen>Self_mover</fen> spends away from the <fen>Source</fen>.
</def-root>

Arg.name: Result
Arg.definition: <def-root>The state of the <fen>Self_mover</fen> at the end of the event.</def-root>

Arg.name: Explanation
Arg.definition:
<def-root>A factor which explains the particular motion or manner of motion of the <fen>Self_mover</fen>.
</def-root>

Arg.name: Reciprocation
Arg.definition: <def-root>An event paired with the motion, which explains why the motion is expected. In particular, <fen>Reciprocation</fen> is used to indicate an action that is being rewarded or punished by the motion, and/or is paired with the motion as the other side of an agreement.</def-root>

Arg.name: Containing_event
Arg.definition: <def-root>An event that occurs or state of affairs that holds at the time of departure and which the departure is taken to be a part of.</def-root>

Arg.name: Frequency
Arg.definition: <def-root>The number of times that an action occurs in a given time.</def-root>

Arg.name: Re-encoding
Arg.definition: <def-root>A larger conceptualization that includes the departing as an integral part. The departure expressed by the target typically corresponds to a Means action in this larger conceptualization. </def-root>

Arg.name: New_situation
Arg.definition: <def-root>An unexpected event that affects some agent (usually the <fen>Self_mover</fen>), which is enabled by, and occurs after, the departing.</def-root>

Arg.name: Circumstances
Arg.definition: <def-root>The state of the world (at a particular time and place) which is specifically independent of the departing event itself and any of its participants, and is merely peripherally related to the event as a whole.</def-root>

Arg.name: Coordinated_event
Arg.definition: <def-root>The label <fen>Coordinated_event</fen> is to be used for phrases denoting an event (it does not allow states) that the departing is rhythmically aligned with. (This would then further require that the departing be iterated.) The <fen>Coordinated_event</fen> is conceived of as independent: it would occur regardless of the event expressed by the target, which is not even an incidental or optional sub-part of the <fen>Coordinated_event</fen>. </def-root>

Arg.name: Distance
Arg.definition: <def-root>The distance from the <fen>Source</fen> that the <fen>Self_mover</fen> ends up.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: set off.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: (support verb set) begin a journey.
